SENT.plain: Wiedemann-Beckwith syndrome (WBS) is a congenital anomaly syndrome which classically consists of exomphalos, macroglossia, and gigantism
The syndrome is also associated with a variety of minor anomalies and affected individuals have an increased risk of developing rare embryonal cell tumors
To date, 15 monozygotic (MZ) twin pairs have been reported of which 13 are discordant for WBS
All except one pair of the discordant WBS twin pairs have been female
We report two pairs of male MZ twins, each discordant for WBS
